seg.line: 聖人以治天下為事者也，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: official business; official purpose; public affairs; public duties 倦於事

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,
they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,
they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,

sense.def: understand properly; understand and respect properly; be sure of the workings (of something);

tls:text.tls:line: they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,
they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,

sense.def: political revolt; political unrest, political turmoil; disorderliness, unruliness; acts of political insubordinacy

tls:text.tls:line: they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,

sense.def: political chaos; political disarray, political disorder

tls:text.tls:line: they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,
they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,

sense.def: OBI 5: from; starting out from a place; 自楚之滕 "went from Chu3 to Te2ng" also a time: 所自生 "that wherefrom something is born"

tls:text.tls:line: they must certainly know where the disorder arises from,
then they are able to govern it.

sense.def: 焉＝於之 at that point, first then

tls:text.tls:line: then they are able to govern it.
then they are able to govern it.
then they are not able to govern it.
then they are not able to govern it.

sense.def: govern the contextually determinate N properly

seg.line: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

sense.def: 如日月之食焉 resemble a fact, situation or action expressed by a nominalised sentence

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

sense.def: the situation that S, the circumstances of S, the details of S

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

sense.def: try to deal with effectively, attack (a disease or a weak point)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

sense.def: OBI 5: acute sickness; current state of sickness; also: xīn jí 心疾 "indisposition/illness of the heart/mind"; sickness 斯疾 temporary indisposition; falling sick

tls:text.tls:srcline: 譬之如醫之攻人之疾者然，
tls:text.tls:line: Things are the same as with a doctor who wants to cure someone else's disease.

sense.def: be like this situation/case> be like the case of S

tls:text.tls:line: He must certainly know where the disease arises from,
He must certainly know where the disease arises from,

sense.def: understand properly; understand and respect properly; be sure of the workings (of something);

tls:text.tls:line: He must certainly know where the disease arises from,
He must certainly know where the disease arises from,
He must certainly know where the disease arises from,
then he is able to cure it.

sense.def: 焉＝於之 at that point, first then

tls:text.tls:line: If he does not know where the disease arises from,
then he is not able to cure it.

sense.def: could not, cannot, fail to; be unable to

tls:text.tls:line: then he is not able to cure it.
then he is not able to cure it.
then he is not able to cure it.

sense.def: have the capacity to VERB properly, be constitutionally able to VERB; be physically capable of, be actually able to

tls:text.tls:line: How, then, should it be any different for those who govern disorder?
How, then, should it be any different for those who govern disorder?

sense.def: political chaos; political disarray, political disorder

tls:text.tls:line: How, then, should it be any different for those who govern disorder?

sense.def: the situation of Nab, the circumstances of Nab, the details of Nab

tls:text.tls:line: How, then, should it be any different for those who govern disorder?

sense.def: how in this only case> how on earth?

tls:text.tls:line: How, then, should it be any different for those who govern disorder?

sense.def: the contextually determinate S is true; it is so (mostly, the word in this meaning is used pro-sententially, as a pro-sentence)

tls:text.tls:line: They must certainly know where the disorder arises from,
then they are able to govern it.

sense.def: 焉＝於之 at that point, first then

tls:text.tls:line: then they are not able to govern it.

sense.def: read chí: reduce the contextually determinate N to order

tls:text.tls:line: then they are not able to govern it.

sense.def: read chí: get into working order, cause to be in working order

seg.line: 聖人以治天下為事者也，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: to reduce to order; to put in order (the administration etc); to be in administrative charge of, to deal with, take care of; to be in charge of, take administrative responsibility for; to regulate, make regular, control (as breath)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: think that the N Vs; consider that S;

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: object marker: 把(這個東西) also: 以。。。而。。。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 聖人以治天下為事者也，
tls:text.tls:line: As for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: 以N為V: regard N as V-ing; believe that N V-s 以汝為死

tls:text.tls:line: they inevitably have to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: have to; must; should by all means; should not fail to

tls:text.tls:line: they inevitably have to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: look closely into, pay close attention to and investigate

tls:text.tls:line: they inevitably have to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: something chaotic; a chaotic state; a chaotic situation, political chaos

tls:text.tls:line: they inevitably have to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: OBI 5: from; starting out from a place; 自楚之滕 "went from Chu3 to Te2ng" also a time: 所自生 "that wherefrom something is born"

tls:text.tls:line: Let us try to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: one should (NOTE THAT MANY ATTRIBUTIONS FROM vt+V[0] HAVE TO BE MOVED HERE.)

tls:text.tls:line: Let us try to investigate where the disorder arises from.
Let us try to investigate where the disorder arises from.

sense.def: 何以知其然 "using what does one know that this is so?"

tls:text.tls:line: Let us try to investigate where the disorder arises from.
It arises from the fact that people do not spare each other.
That subject and son do not serve their ruler or father in piety
That subject and son do not serve their ruler or father in piety
That subject and son do not serve their ruler or father in piety

sense.def: show proper dutiful love (to parents, ancestors or ghosts)

tls:text.tls:line: That subject and son do not serve their ruler or father in piety
is something called disorder.

sense.def: something chaotic; a chaotic state; a chaotic situation, political chaos

tls:text.tls:line: is something called disorder.

sense.def: what is properly called, what goes by the name; what is here called

tls:text.tls:line: Since a son spares himself and not his father,
Since a son spares himself and not his father,

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: Since a son spares himself and not his father,

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: he therefore harms his father and benefits himself.
he therefore harms his father and benefits himself.

sense.def: benefit; be profitable for; provide for the good of; work for the profit of, be of benefit to

tls:text.tls:line: Since a younger brother spares himself and not his older brother,
Since a younger brother spares himself and not his older brother,

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: Since a younger brother spares himself and not his older brother,

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: Since a younger brother spares himself and not his older brother,

sense.def: the elder brother of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: he therefore harms his older brother and benefits himself.
he therefore harms his older brother and benefits himself.

sense.def: the elder brother of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: he therefore harms his older brother and benefits himself.

sense.def: benefit; be profitable for; provide for the good of; work for the profit of, be of benefit to

tls:text.tls:line: Since a subject spares himself and not his ruler,

sense.def: the minister in general, ministers in general

tls:text.tls:line: Since a subject spares himself and not his ruler,
Since a subject spares himself and not his ruler,
he therefore harms his ruler and benefits himself.
This is something that is called disorder.

sense.def: what is properly called, what goes by the name; what is here called

tls:text.tls:line: Even if the father does not show parental care for his son,

sense.def: even Mo: 雖我亦將非之。

tls:text.tls:line: Even if the father does not show parental care for his son,
Even if the father does not show parental care for his son,

sense.def: show loving parental or parental-style care for

tls:text.tls:line: Even if the father does not show parental care for his son,
Even if the father does not show parental care for his son,

sense.def: son of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: the elder brother does not show parental care for his younger brother,

sense.def: show loving parental or parental-style care for

tls:text.tls:line: the elder brother does not show parental care for his younger brother,

sense.def: younger brother of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: the ruler does not show parental care for his subject,

sense.def: show loving parental or parental-style care for

tls:text.tls:line: the ruler does not show parental care for his subject,

sense.def: minister of the contextually determinate superordinate person

tls:text.tls:line: then this is also something that the world calls disorder.

sense.def: what is properly called, what goes by the name; what is here called

tls:text.tls:line: then this is also something that the world calls disorder.
then this is also something that the world calls disorder.
then this is also something that the world calls disorder.
and not his son,

sense.def: son of the contextually determinate N

he therefore harms his son and benefits himself.

sense.def: marks a judgmental question sentence 何謂也What does this mean?

tls:text.tls:line: Why is this the case?

sense.def: what is the reason for N?

tls:text.tls:line: All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
Even with those who are acting as robbers and murderers in the world,

sense.def: even when it comes to the N they V

tls:text.tls:line: Even with those who are acting as robbers and murderers in the world,

sense.def: NP1 indicates the placing in space of NP2 四海之內

tls:text.tls:line: Even with those who are acting as robbers and murderers in the world,

tls:text.tls:line: Even with those who are acting as robbers and murderers in the world,
Even with those who are acting as robbers and murderers in the world,
it is the same.
it is the same.

sense.def: be like the contextually determinate Npro

tls:text.tls:line: The great ones each spare their own families,
The great ones each spare their own families,
The great ones each spare their own families,
The great ones each spare their own families,
A robber spares his [own] house,
A robber spares his [own] house,
but not others' houses,
but not others' houses,
therefore he robs others' houses in order to benefit his [own] house.
therefore he robs others' houses in order to benefit his [own] house.
therefore he robs others' houses in order to benefit his [own] house.
therefore he robs others' houses in order to benefit his [own] house.
therefore he robs others' houses in order to benefit his [own] house.
A murderer spares his [own] body,
A murderer spares his [own] body,
A murderer spares his [own] body,

sense.def: N's own personality; N's own personal convictions; N's own personal character??, N's own personal characteristics; the very person constituted by N

tls:text.tls:line: A murderer spares his [own] body,
but not [that of] others,
therefore he murders others in order to benefit his own.

sense.def: murder as hired murderer; kill secretly; to launch an indriect murderous attack against

tls:text.tls:line: therefore he murders others in order to benefit his own.

sense.def: damage and ruin, harm; try to harm viciously; do villainous harm to

sense.def: what is the reason for N?

tls:text.tls:line: Why is this the case?

sense.def: marks a judgmental question sentence 何謂也What does this mean?

tls:text.tls:line: All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.

seg.line: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，
tls:text.tls:line: Even with the great ones who bring their families into disorder mutually or with the rulers who attack their countries mutually,

sense.def: even when it comes to the N they V

tls:text.tls:srcline: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，
tls:text.tls:line: Even with the great ones who bring their families into disorder mutually or with the rulers who attack their countries mutually,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，
tls:text.tls:line: Even with the great ones who bring their families into disorder mutually or with the rulers who attack their countries mutually,

sense.def: 老之將至 nominaliser converting a subject-VP predicate sentence into an abstract nominalisation

tls:text.tls:srcline: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，
tls:text.tls:line: Even with the great ones who bring their families into disorder mutually or with the rulers who attack their countries mutually,

sense.def: each others' N 相亂國 “vt each others' state"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 雖至大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者，
tls:text.tls:line: Even with the great ones who bring their families into disorder mutually or with the rulers who attack their countries mutually,
it is the same.

sense.def: to be so, to be like this, to be such (stands for verbal predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: but not other families,
but not other families,
but not other families,
therefore they bring other families into disorder in order to benefit their own families.
therefore they bring other families into disorder in order to benefit their own families.
The rulers each spare their own countries,
The rulers each spare their own countries,
The rulers each spare their own countries,
The rulers each spare their own countries,
but not foreign countries,
but not foreign countries,
therefore they attack foreign countries in order to benefit their own countries.

sense.def: launch an attack (which is not necessarily successful) against; direct attack; assault, personally attack (a person); sometimes used very generally: attack (an opponent, in any way) [The examples have to be distributed into the subcategories below.]

tls:text.tls:line: therefore they attack foreign countries in order to benefit their own countries.
therefore they attack foreign countries in order to benefit their own countries.

sense.def: benefit; be profitable for; provide for the good of; work for the profit of, be of benefit to

tls:text.tls:line: therefore they attack foreign countries in order to benefit their own countries.
All cases of disorder in the world
All cases of disorder in the world

sense.def: disorderly, unruly; chaotic; doomed to chaos; bent on chaos

tls:text.tls:line: All cases of disorder in the world
can be subsumed into this.
can be subsumed into this.

sense.def: be like this; work like this

tls:text.tls:line: can be subsumed into this.

sense.def: ..., and that is all. [Note the immensely complex problems of scope of this phrase.]

tls:text.tls:line: Let us investigate where this arises from.
Let us investigate where this arises from.

sense.def: this (particular aforementioned abstract but definite) item

sense.def: 何以知其然 "using what does one know that this is so?"

All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
All this is due to the fact that people do not spare each other.
If one made everyone in the world spare each other
If one made everyone in the world spare each other
If one made everyone in the world spare each other

sense.def: each of the objects singly, every object; each object in its own way 兼而 sometimes neutralised: all the objects in a blanket way

tls:text.tls:line: If one made everyone in the world spare each other
If one made everyone in the world spare each other
If one made everyone in the world spare each other

sense.def: if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )

tls:text.tls:line: If one made everyone in the world spare each other

sense.def: cause N to V, bring it about that N V-s 使之聞之 [NB: the first 之shows that the object of 使 does function as an object and not only as a subject of wén 聞. Thus technically speaking we do not have a sentence after the vt.]

tls:text.tls:line: and spare others as they spare their [own] bodies,
and spare others as they spare their [own] bodies,

sense.def: preposed object topic> others in general

tls:text.tls:line: and spare others as they spare their [own] bodies,

sense.def: to V2 in the way one is V1-ing> like, just as

tls:text.tls:line: would there still be those who would not practice filial piety?

seg.line: 視父兄與君若其身惡施不孝？

If one regarded other people's families like one's own,
If one regarded the countries of others like one's [own] country,

sense.def: look upon (e.g. the people)(e.g. like their father or mother)

tls:text.tls:line: If one regarded the countries of others like one's [own] country,

sense.def: as if it was, i.e. Vt the object N2 as if it was an N1

tls:text.tls:line: If one regarded the countries of others like one's [own] country,
If one regarded the countries of others like one's [own] country,
how could one not [yet] practice parental care?
how could one not [yet] practice parental care?
who would still murder [other people]?

sense.def: be villainous, commit acts of villainy

tls:text.tls:line: who would still murder [other people]?
who would still attack the countries of others?
who would still attack the countries of others?

sense.def: launch an attack, undertake a military attack

seg.line: 故大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者有亡。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者有亡。
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, there would be no more great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and no more rulers who would attack each other's countries.

sense.def: each others' N 相亂國 “vt each others' state"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者有亡。
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, there would be no more great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and no more rulers who would attack each other's countries.

sense.def: cause to be chaotic, reduce to chaos; mix something chaotically into (something else); wreak havoc in; disrupt

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者有亡。
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, there would be no more great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and no more rulers who would attack each other's countries.

sense.def: launch an attack (which is not necessarily successful) against; direct attack; assault, personally attack (a person); sometimes used very generally: attack (an opponent, in any way) [The examples have to be distributed into the subcategories below.]

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者有亡。
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, there would be no more great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and no more rulers who would attack each other's countries.
If one made everyone in the world spare each other,

sense.def: if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )

tls:text.tls:line: If one made everyone in the world spare each other,

sense.def: cause N to V, bring it about that N V-s 使之聞之 [NB: the first 之shows that the object of 使 does function as an object and not only as a subject of wén 聞. Thus technically speaking we do not have a sentence after the vt.]

tls:text.tls:line: If one made everyone in the world spare each other,
[for 有亡 read 亡有] Therefore, there would be no more lack of filial piety and parental care.
[for 有亡 read 亡有] Therefore, there would be no more lack of filial piety and parental care.
[for 有亡 read 亡有] Therefore, there would be no more lack of filial piety and parental care.
who would still cause disorder?
who would still cause disorder?
Would there still be robbers and murderers?

sense.def: still; nonetheless; in spite of everything (said in S and not said in S)

tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be robbers and murderers?
Would there still be robbers and murderers?

sense.def: final question particle after verbal sentence 管仲儉乎？"Was Guǎnzhòng stingy?"

tls:text.tls:line: who would still rob other people's houses?
who would still rob other people's houses?
[for 有亡 read 亡有] Therefore, there would be no more robbers and murderers.

seg.line: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

sense.def: 老之將至 nominaliser converting a subject-VP predicate sentence into an abstract nominalisation

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

sense.def: each others' N 相亂國 “vt each others' state"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

sense.def: each others' N 相亂國 “vt each others' state"

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

sense.def: relative clause marker equivalent to 而

tls:text.tls:srcline: 猶有大夫之相亂家、諸侯之相攻國者乎？
tls:text.tls:line: Would there still be great ones who would bring each other's families into disorder and rulers who would attack each other's countries?

sense.def: 臣之弒君者 “ministers who assassinate their rulers"

tls:text.tls:line: countries would no longer attack each other,
families would no longer bring each other into disorder.
Robbers and murderers would no longer exist,
Robbers and murderers would no longer exist,

sense.def: there is no such thing as N

tls:text.tls:line: ruler and subject, father and son, would all be able to exercise filial piety and parental care.

sense.def: show loving respect for one's parents and ancestors (see VIRTUE)

tls:text.tls:line: ruler and subject, father and son, would all be able to exercise filial piety and parental care.
If this was the case, the world would be in order.
If this was the case, the world would be in order.

sense.def: the inhabited world cf. 天之下

tls:text.tls:line: If this was the case, the world would be in order.

sense.def: be in good order; be well-governed, be well-ordered; of persons: be in good shape

seg.line: 故聖人以治天下為事者，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故聖人以治天下為事者，
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, as for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故聖人以治天下為事者，
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, as for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: a sage; any sage (with tensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 故聖人以治天下為事者，
tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, as for the wise men, who address themselves to the task of governing the world,

sense.def: 把N1算是N2 consider N1 as N2

tls:text.tls:line: how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?
how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?
how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?

sense.def: prohibit, forbid, cause to stop, put a stop to prevent, ban; preclude, prevent; constrain; contain

tls:text.tls:line: how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?
how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?
how can they not prohibit doing harm and encourage sparing?

sense.def: loving care, preferential care for others

tls:text.tls:line: If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.
If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.
If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.

sense.def: each of the objects singly, every object; each object in its own way 兼而 sometimes neutralised: all the objects in a blanket way

tls:text.tls:line: If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.
If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.
If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: If, therefore, everyone in the world spared each other, then order would prevail.
But if everyone harms each other, then disorder will reign.
But if everyone harms each other, then disorder will reign.

sense.def: hate openly, detest, dislike strongly; LY 4.3: truly and properly dislike 甚惡"strongly dislike"

tls:text.tls:line: But if everyone harms each other, then disorder will reign.

sense.def: there is political chaos; there was a rebellion

tls:text.tls:line: But if everyone harms each other, then disorder will reign.

sense.def: take a hostile attitude towards, act hatefully towards

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore, this is exactly what Master Mo [means when he] says
that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.
that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.

sense.def: urge the contextually determinate N to V

tls:text.tls:line: that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.
that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.
that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.

sense.def: take good care of; 好好照顧

tls:text.tls:line: that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.

sense.def: preposed object topic> others in general

tls:text.tls:line: that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.

sense.def: other persons; other people; all the other people

tls:text.tls:line: that one can't help but encourage others to spare themselves.

sense.def: the situation of Nab, the circumstances of Nab, the details of Nab
